meanings.definition: The act of constructing or repairing with stone or brick.
meanings.sent1: The masoning of the wall was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: His masoning skills were evident in the sturdy fireplace he built.
meanings.sent3: The masoning of the castle made it look like a fortress from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: Her masoning of relationships brought people together like building blocks.
meanings.sent5: The masoning of the ancient ruins revealed the craftsmanship of the past.

meanings.definition: The skill or trade of a mason.
meanings.sent1: Learning masoning requires patience and precision.
meanings.sent2: His grandfather passed down the art of masoning to him.
meanings.sent3: The masoning of intricate designs on the cathedral was truly impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her masoning of words in poetry showed her talent for language.
meanings.sent5: The masoning of the stone pathway was a testament to his expertise.

meanings.definition: The process of building or working with masonry materials.
meanings.sent1: The masoning of the archway took days to complete.
meanings.sent2: Masoning involves careful selection of materials and tools.
meanings.sent3: The masoning of the garden wall added charm to the backyard.
meanings.sent4: His masoning of the foundation laid the groundwork for the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The masoning of the bridge showcased the beauty of stone craftsmanship.
